edu.asu.ying.mapreduce.table

Interface ElementSource

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DelimitedTextSource

    public interface ElementSource
    ElementSource objects read elements from a data stream and pass them to into an ElementSink chain.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ElementSink getNextSink()
      Return the next element sink in the chain.
      void readNextElement()
      Reads the next element from the data source.
      void readNextElement(int timeout)
      Reads the next element from the data source.
      void readNextElements(int maxCount)
      Reads the next element from the data source.
      void readNextElements(int maxCount, int timeout)
      Reads the next element from the data source.

    • Method Detail

      • getNextSink

        ElementSink getNextSink()
        Return the next element sink in the chain.

      • readNextElement

        void readNextElement()
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Reads the next element from the data source.

        Blocks if no element is available until one becomes available or the underlying data source becomes unavailable.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading from the underlying data source throws an exception.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if no more elements are available or if the underlying data source closes or becomes otherwise unavailable.

      • readNextElement

        void readNextElement(int timeout)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Reads the next element from the data source.

        If timeout is greater than 0, then the call will block for timeout milliseconds before throwing NoSuchElementException. If timeout <= 0, the call will block until an element is available.

        Parameters:
        timeout - if > 0, the call will block for timeout ms before throwing NoSuchElementException. If <= 0, the call will block until an element is available.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading from the underlying data source throws an exception.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if no more elements are available, timeout ms is exceeded before any elements become available, or if the underlying data source closes or becomes otherwise unavailable.

      • readNextElements

        void readNextElements(int maxCount)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Reads the next element from the data source.

        Blocks if no element is available until one becomes available or the underlying data source becomes unavailable.

        Parameters:
        maxCount - maximum number of elements to read.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading from the underlying data source throws an exception.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if no more elements are available or if the underlying data source closes or becomes otherwise unavailable.

      • readNextElements

        void readNextElements(int maxCount,
                    int timeout)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Reads the next element from the data source.

        If timeout is greater than 0, then the call will block for timeout milliseconds before throwing NoSuchElementException. If timeout <= 0, the call will block until an element is available.

        Parameters:
        maxCount - maximum number of elements to read.
        timeout - if > 0, the call will block for timeout ms before throwing NoSuchElementException. If <= 0, the call will block until an element is available.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if reading from the underlying data source throws an exception.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if no more elements are available, timeout ms is exceeded before any elements become available, or if the underlying data source closes or becomes otherwise unavailable.
